snippet: The largest United States public pension plan said this week that it had bought more than $1 billion in real estate assets in the last six months, with half of the purchases coming in California.     The pension plan, the California Public Employe...
lead_paragraph: The largest United States public pension plan said this week that it had bought more than $1 billion in real estate assets in the last six months, with half of the purchases coming in California. The pension plan, the California Public Employees' Retirement System, known as Calpers, which has overseas assets of more than $155 billion, said it was taking advantage of low stock prices for real estate investment trusts, or REIT's, that have caused the trusts to sell off properties.
abstract: California Public Employees' Retirement System purchases more than $1 billion worth of real estate in past six months, half of it in California (S)
